msItem.rubric: Incipits of the homilies (a few lines until Text I-4, and occasionally thereafter, e.g., Text I-22; otherwise mostly three rubricated lines alterating with black lines); notes in the upper margin of the fols. indicating occasions for the reading; elements of the punctuation signs, throughout until Text I-4, and with interruptions thereafter; elements of the text dividers thereafter throughout the Ms.

msItem.note: The collection of homilies contained in the Ms. is similar to that in Mss. Orient 744 (WrBriMus no. cccxl), Tanasee 131 = Daga Estifanos 20 (SixTana III, 126-32), Orient. Fol. 3075 (HamSixBerl no. 161,296-301). The sequence of the homilies is different.

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. has been rebound; the threads of the sewing are broken; the original sewing is missing. The original order of the fols. is disturbed; the parts of the manuscript were probably put together in wrong order (perhaps as the result of repair). Fol. 126 should be between fols. 144 and 145. Many fols. are held together by stitch repairs, someitimes so tightly that the structure of the quires cannot be discerned.

The one who donated this book is I, ʿaqabe säʿat Täsäbkä Mädḫǝn. To Yoḥannǝs, to Däbrä Maʿṣo what I donated is Chrisostomos and Paul (?) and censers and wäsutäy. When I borrowed the treasures (gǝmza) of Yoḥannǝs, I paid back with falot (?) of my wife, having taken (it), while I, Täsäbkä Mädḫǝn, am the ʿaqabe säʿat; and the śǝyyum is his father Hallo ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer, and his wife is ʾAsmǝʿu, and the king is Dawit a son of Sefarʿad, and mäkʷännǝn is ʾAron, and maʾkäl baḥr is Zä-ʾAmanuʾel. Anyone who plundered and robbed, who sold and bought, who lent and who borrowed this book shall be cursed, be it a priest or a śǝyyum, be it who it may be, by the mouth of fifteen prophets and by the mouth of twelve apostles and by the mouth of seventy two disciples and by the mouth of three hundred eighteen orthodox (fathers), by the mouth of Father and Son and Holy Spirit and by the mouth of our Lady Mary shall be cursed, and if someone scrapes (it), shall be cursed for ever and ever. Amen.

- Fol. 1r-v: Luke 6:36-7:7, a fragment of an old (pre-1350) Four Gospels manuscript. - Crude writing excercises (?): fols. 2v-3r, 24r - Very crude writing exercises or pen trials, in old hands: fol. 142v, fol. 146v: ወጥን፡ በሰናይ፡ ፈጽም፡ በጽድ[ቅ]; fol. 149r (in red ink). - Crude writing exercise and attempt at drawing an ornamental band: fol. 149v.

origin.origDate: According to Additio 6, the Ms. was donated in the time of King Dawit II (r. ca. 1382-1412), mäkʷännǝn Aron, and maʾkäl baḥr Zä-ʾAmanuʾel. Fol. 1 originates from an older (pre-1350?) Four Gospels book.
